title: We are destroying software
author: antirez
aiHeadline: Software Development is Apparently a Form of Digital Vandalism and We're All Just a Bunch of Cyber Hooligans According to This Scathing Indictment of the Industry, Because Who Needs Functional Code Anyway?

title: The Deck: An open-source cross-platform multiplayer card game engine in Flutter
author: igor_st
aiHeadline: Get Ready to Waste Hours of Your Life Playing Cards with Strangers on the Internet, Thanks to This Open-Source Cross-Platform Multiplayer Card Game Engine in Flutter, Because Productivity is Overrated and Solitaire Just Isn't Cutting It Anymore

title: Ghostwriter – use the reMarkable2 as an interface to vision-LLMs
author: wonger_
aiHeadline: Some Genius Has Figured Out How to Turn the reMarkable2 into a Magical Interface for Vision-LLMs, Which is Just a Fancy Way of Saying They've Created a Gadget That Lets You Talk to AI Like It's a Ouija Board, But with More Sloppy Handwriting

title: Jacksonpollock.org
author: memalign
aiHeadline: In a Bizarre Tribute to Abstract Art, Someone Has Created a Website That Lets You Create Your Own Masterpiece, or More Likely, a Kindergarten-Level Mess, in the Style of Jackson Pollock, Because Who Needs Talent When You Have a Mouse and a Can of Virtual Paint?

title: Show HN: FlashSpace – fast, open-source, macOS Spaces replacement
author: wojciech-kulik
aiHeadline: The macOS Spaces Replacement You Never Knew You Needed is Here, and It's Called FlashSpace, Which is Either a Lifesaver for the Organizationally Challenged or a Desperate Cry for Help from Someone Who Can't Handle a Little Digital Clutter, Either Way, It's Free and Open-Source, So Go Forth and Conquer Your Desktop
